en:
Formerly in the Forman Collection 362; purchased in Sotheby Sale, 21 June
      1899, cat. no. 362.

Eutychia (labelled), standing 3/4-view to the right, with her weight on
      her left leg, wearing a belted, sleeveless chiton, a beaded (?) necklace, bead earrings, a
      high pony tail, holds a beaded necklace in her lowered right hand, and holds a footed box in
      her bent left arm; she slightly obscures a bed (?) emerging to her right; a winged, white
      (with red wings), nude Himeros (labelled), standing 3/4-view to the right, with his weight on
      his left leg, and his right leg relaxed, holds a beaded necklace in his lowered right hand,
      and extends an olive (?) wreath to the right, with his left hand; Aphrodite, seated 3/4-view
      to the left, wearing a belted, sleeved chiton with shoulder bands, a himation over her legs,
      and a sphendone, rests her left hand at her side, and holds her right hand in front of her
      face; Eros (?), standing 3/4-view to the right, holds olive branches (all but the top of the
      torso and wings are missing); Makaria (labelled), standing 3/4-view to the left, wearing a
      belted peplos, and a long pony tail, holds a long necklace (or branch of fruit?) between her
      upraised right hand (held in front of her mouth) and her lowered left
      hand.

<bibl>Shapiro 1993</bibl>, 171-72, 238 no. 33, figs. 42, 68, 132;
      <bibl>LIMC</bibl>, 5.425-26 s.v. Himeros no. 9 (A. Hermary);
      <bibl>LIMC</bibl>, 4.126 s.v. Eutychia no. 3, pl. 67 (H.A. Shapiro);
      <bibl>LIMC</bibl>, 2.122 s.v. Aphrodite no. 1269, pl. 127 (A. Delivorrias);
      <bibl>Para</bibl>, 479; A.D. Ure, "Recent Acquisitions by the Museum of Greek
      Archaeology, Reading," <hi rend="ital">ArchRep</hi> 1962-1963, 61 no. 19, fig. 16;
      J.D. Beazley, "Some Inscriptions on Vases," <hi rend="ital">AJA</hi> 61 (1957)
      8.
